title: Eiffel Tower Light Show
context: The Eiffel Tower has a nightly light show that begins after sunset and runs every hour on the hour until 1 a.m.
question: When does the Eiffel Tower's nightly light show occur?

text: After sunset every hour on the hour

title: Morning Prayers
context: Morning prayers in many monasteries begin at the first light of dawn, following a tradition that spans centuries.
question: When do morning prayers begin?

text: At the first light of dawn

title: Harvest Festival
context: The annual harvest festival is celebrated when the crops are fully harvested, marking the end of the agricultural season.
question: When is the harvest festival celebrated?

text: When the crops are fully harvested

title: Meteor Shower
context: The meteor shower is best observed late at night, once the skies are dark and clear.
question: When is the meteor shower best observed?

text: Late at night when the skies are dark

title: High Tide Observation
context: The high tide observation on coastal beaches occurs when the tide reaches its peak, drawing crowds to witness the phenomenon.
question: When does the high tide observation occur?

text: When the tide reaches its peak

title: Hurricane Preparation
context: Residents begin hurricane preparations as soon as a hurricane warning is issued by local authorities.
question: When do residents begin hurricane preparations?

text: As soon as a hurricane warning is issued

title: First Snowfall Celebration
context: Communities in the region celebrate the first snowfall of the season, marking the beginning of winter festivities.
question: When is the first snowfall celebrated?

text: At the first snowfall of the season

context: Bird migration typically occurs at dawn, as flocks take advantage of calm winds and cooler temperatures.
